生物材料分析技术实验讲义
尹光福、周大利、廖晓明、蒲曦鸣、陈显春
本课程是生物医学工程专业生物材料方向的专业基础实验课，其内容包括：红外光谱分析实验、材料力学性能分析实验、软物质材料力学性能分析实验、紫外-可见光光谱分析实验、生物材料表面性能分析实验、材料表面电位测量等现代材料科学测试方法内容。
包括：红外光谱分析实验、材料力学性能分析实验、软物质材料力学分析实验、紫外-可见光光谱分析实验、生物材料表面性能分析实验、材料表面电位测量等现代材料科学测试方法内容。

A growing interest is given to functional nanomaterials and electrospun nanofibers(NFs) are now widely fabricated and studied for new potential applications in fields aslarge as textile industry, nanomedicine, food industry, etc. New generation materialscan be designed and then used in order to improve some specific properties accordingto the desired application. In the field of ceramics, many studies are dedicated to theelaboration of oxides, i.e. Al2O3, TiO2 and SnO2 for instance, but one-dimensionalnon-oxide ceramics are less studied despite their high application potentiality.In this course, a general overview of ceramic materials will be first given beforedetailing how to prepare specific ceramics at the micro- and even nano-scale. Synthesesof 0-dimensional and 1-dimensional structures will be studied, by giving a focus onelectrospinning through fabrication of boron- and iron-based nanostructuressometimes obtained with synthetic precursors and polymers, with a controlled shapeand a high purity. An example of implementation of those filaments will be presentedfor actuating applications, and even an opening on the 3D structuration of suchnanomaterials.
Feynman Path IntegralsApproach to Quantum Mechanics
Feynman Path IntegralsApproach to Quantum Mechanics

Quantum Mechanics is usually taught using canonical quantization. A more modern approach, Feynman’s Path Integrals, provides an elegant and more transparent way to describe many quantum phenomena: interference, tunneling and entanglement among many others. In this course we will introduce the main ideas of Path Integrals and carry out simple calculations of time evolution, symmetry breaking and restoration, decay of a false vacuum and the eigenstates of a periodic potential (Bloch theorem).
Electronic Properties of 2D Materials and Graphene
Electronic Properties of 2D Materials and Graphene

Review of Electronic properties of graphene: Dirac fermions, Chirality, absence of backscattering and Berry phase, Klein tunneling, Landau level. ？Graphene-like 2D materials？Introduction to Scanning Tunneling Microscopy and spectroscopy？Landau level Spectroscopy ？Graphene on graphite – Fermi velocity, quasiparticle lifetime？Suspended graphene – Ballistic transport, quantum Hall effect and Fractional Quantum Hall effect ？Graphene on insulating substrates SiO2 , Graphene and BN.？Twisted graphene – Moire patterns, Van-Hove singularities and suppression of Fermi velocity Supercritical charge and atomic collapse
Introduction to Power Electronic Devices and Applications
Introduction to Power Electronic Devices and Applications

This introductory course is designed to be suitable for students even without much prior knowledge in semiconductor materials and devices. It will start from the necessary basics so the course can be considered self-contained. On the other hand, students will learn several important power semiconductor devices, from power MOSFETs to the newest IGBTs, and more importantly, students will learn how important the power electronic devices to our daily life. The later part of the course will be on the wide bandgap semiconductor materials such as SiC and GaN, sometimes also called the third generation semiconductor materials. It will be shown why the wide bandgap materials is important for power devices , and finally the course will conclude by discussing the future trends in the area.
First-principles Modeling and Simulations for Materials Science
First-principles Modeling and Simulations for Materials Science

The quantum mechanics and its application to solid state physics will be briefly reviewed. The major methods based on the mean-field theory will be introduced. The focus will be on the density-functional theory (DFT). The computational approaches, especially plane wave formalism, will be discussed. The application of methods to study various structural, electronic, optical and magnetic properties of selected materials will be presented. The simulations by molecular dynamics and Monte Carlo methods will also be covered.
Introduction of Hydrogen Energy and Fuel Cell Technologies
Introduction of Hydrogen Energy and Fuel Cell Technologies

Hydrogen is the simplest element. An atom of hydrogen consists of only one proton and one electron. It's also the most plentiful element in the universe. Hydrogen is high in energy, yet an engine that runs pure hydrogen produces almost no pollution. A fuel cell combines hydrogen and oxygen to produce electricity, heat, and water. Fuel cells are a promising technology for use as a source of heat and electricity for buildings, and as an electrical power source for electric motors propelling vehicles. In the future, hydrogen could also join electricity as an important energy carrier. An energy carrier moves and delivers energy in a usable form to consumers. Renewable energy sources, like the sun and wind, can't produce energy all the time. But they could, for example, produce electric energy and hydrogen, which can be stored until it's needed. Hydrogen can also be transported (like electricity) to locations where it is needed.This course describes the operating features of a fuel cell and the underlying thermodynamics and physical factors that determine their performance. A good understanding of these factors is essential to an appreciation of the benefits of fuel cell systems and their operating characteristics compared with conventional combustion-based technology.

This course aims to provide a comprehensive overview of nanomaterials in terms of the synthesis, characterization, properties, and applications. It will cover the fundamental scientific principles for the different synthesis techniques, assembly of nanostructured materials and, new physical and chemical properties at the nanoscale. Existing and emerging applications will also be discussed through case studies.

The course aims at bachelor students, preferably in their second or third year of study with a science background, preferably with a major in Physics, Chemistry or Materials Science.The course deals with the -structure of solid surfaces,-adsorption and surface modification,-techniques of preparation and characterization of thin films,-polymer, liquid crystal, organic and hybrid thin films,-technical application in thin film photovoltaics, light-emitting diodes and thin film transistors.The course consists of lectures on the different topics but includes elements of dicussion to which the students are invited to participate. Such discussion mainly aims at the realization of technical applications and, hence, helps to deepen and use the content of the lectures. Participants are going to apply a number of gerneral principles to the field of thin films and interfaces which they likely have heard in different context. They will also be exposed to principles which will be new for them in one field or the other, depending on the focus of their earlier studies. They are going to learn new facts and techniques. They will see how the realization of technical applications critically depends on detailed scientific discussion.
半导体发展现状与趋势—“芯世界”
The development and trend for semiconductor industry
材料专业是与生产实践紧密联系的。学生在学校课堂上学习的书本知识如与实践相互印证，会起到事半功倍的效果。因此，请相关企业的一线专家进行现场讲解授课+实地参观实践的方式对本专业学生的综合素质提升有重大作用。通过专家讲解+实地参观实践的方式，除了验证、加深学生所学专业知识以外，让学生了解所学专业的行业发展情况和现状，进一步提高专业自信心，使学生实实在在感觉到学有所用、学能促用的理念
本课程专注于介绍目前半导体材料及其行业的发展现状与趋势，通过鲜活的实例展示目前该产业蓬勃发展的创新源泉以及国内存在的相关技术及发展瓶颈
Quantum Topology and Solid State Physics
量子拓扑是2016年诺贝尔物理学获奖的内容。本课程介绍量子拓扑概念的提炼与运用与科学水平的规律。授课者的导师获得了2016年诺贝尔物理学奖，将指导学生如何辨认理解概念，加深对概念的敏感与重视。从固体物理中提炼出来的概念，除了用于材料科学外，被引入物理其它领域从而对天体物理，基本粒子的发展也起到关键作用。 课程介绍一系列这样的基本概念 并对这些概念的产生于发展做出评论
传统上固体物理是为材料科学、电子工程、机械工程等服务的基础科学。能带、准粒子、费米面固体物理中提炼出来的基本概念。拓扑相变、超导也同样是固体物理产生的概念。这些概念不仅停留于固体物理，也被其它物理领域如天体物理，基本粒子引入而推进了这些领域的发展。概念的提炼与运用很大程度上直接挂钩学科的水准。这个课程中，我们对这样一些的概念的产生与发展做出介绍
Frontier and application of photovoltaic technology
《材料力学》钟大鸣 主编  化学工业出版社
本课程根据材料科学与工程专业的特点，注重对材料力学基本理论与基本概念的阐述，培养学生掌握基本技能和技巧，课程精选内容，体现少而精的原则
内容包括：第一章 绪论、第二章 拉压与剪切、第三章 圆轴扭转、第四章 弯曲内力、第五章 弯曲应力、第六章 弯曲变形、第七章 应力状态分析及强度理论、第八章 组合变形、第九章 压杆的稳定性
材料科学与工程导论（双语）
Introduction of Materials Science and Engineering
本课程为专业基础必修课，要求学生掌握从材料设计、组织控制、制备加工到性能评价与工程应用的概念体系，理解材料科学与工程内涵，学会分析材料问题的方法。了解材料科学的基础专业词汇以及国内外材料领域发展的最新动态。
本课程主要内容包括：Introduction of Materials Science、晶体学基础、金属及合金的晶体结构、陶瓷材料、聚合物材料、晶体生长基础、原子排列中的缺陷、固体中原子的扩散、二元相图以及材料科学发展的前沿动态等。

本课程是材料物理的专业基础课，其内容包括：功能材料的科学基础，包括晶体学基础及材料性能等；金属功能材料，包括超导材料、贮氢合金、形状记忆合金、非晶态合金、磁性材料；无机非金属功能材料,包括半导体材料、功能陶瓷、纳米材料等；低维功能材料，包括功能薄膜材料、新型功能材料等。并重点讲述功能复合材料，包括构成、特性及机理。
本课程的目的与任务是通过本课程的学习，使学生掌握和了解功能材料分类、特性，同时熟悉功能材料光、电、磁、声等性能，为后续课程的学习和将来的功能材料研究工作打下基础。
本课程主要内容包括：功能材料基础知识、无机非金属功能材料、金属功能材料、低维功能材料、功能复合材料、功能材料电磁声光等特性、功能材料发展的前沿动态等。将重点讲授功能复合材料概论。

能源是人类生存及发展的物质基础，也是人类从事各种活动的动力之源。随着人口的迅速增长和人类生活质量的不断提高，化石能源日益减少，人类对能源的需求大幅增加。太阳能、氢能、核能、生物质能、化学能、风能、海洋能和地热能的能量转化、能量存储和能量传输的理论与技术具有非常重要的作用和价值。通过这门课的学习，使学生掌握新能源及相应技术涉及到的原理、组成、材料、组装及应用，熟悉各类新能源材料及器件的特点，同时了解其研发前景，为学生毕业后从事新能源及相关领域的研究和开发工作打下基础。

本课程主要讲述新能源材料及相关技术。主要内容包括：（1）太阳能；（2）氢能；（3）核能；（4）生物质能；（5）化学电源，包括镍氢电池、锂离子电池、燃料电池等；（6）其他能源，包括风能、海洋能、地热能、可燃冰等。重点介绍太阳能、氢能、生物质能及化学电源。
本课程的目标是使学生了解新能源的基本概念，熟悉相关的新能源技术。为学生在未来的工作中进一步学习、研究及设计新能源材料与器件奠定基础。
